programme.desc: A Chihuahua in emergency labor has Dr. Nicole on high alert as she attempts to save the mother and puppies. The clinic reels in a curious case of a cat and a fishhook, while a preemie goat and a spooked trail horse both need care for their ailing eyes. Dr. Pol weighs in on an age-old debate: crunchy or smooth?.

programme.title: Amazonia
programme.desc: Stealthy jaguars prowl, army ants swarm and tarantulas bring down rodent prey when seasonal flooding gives way to the dry season and millions of miles of rain forest habitat is revealed.

programme.title: Underdogs
programme.desc: Ryan shares his distinct take on the underdogs using gross-out tactics to win the game of life. With manatees using flatulence to control their buoyancy to cave-dwelling fungus gnats creating beautifully illuminated flytraps with mucus from their butts, these underdogs are out to prove who may be the grossest survivor of them all.

programme.title: Underdogs
programme.desc: Forget the birds and the bees, Ryan reveals the steps to finding ‚Äúthe one,‚Äù underdog style. From first attraction in giant-nosed proboscis monkeys to the importance of wingmen in turkey courtship or even foreplay with flying foxes, these animals are rewriting the rule book on messy and complicated relationships in the animal kingdom.

programme.title: Underdogs
programme.desc: Ryan Reynolds puts the spotlight on the underdogs who get ahead by dishonest means. From the master-of-disguise frogfish to a butt-biting jackal and a multiheaded caterpillar playing the decoy, they are the masters of deception and deceit. And bringing all these hustlers together is the greatest con artist of them all ‚Äì a cunning macaque who feeds on the spoils from unsuspecting tourists.

programme.title: Underdogs
programme.desc: Ryan Reynolds reveals some highly questionable parenting strategies from the animal kingdom‚Äôs worst parents, the underdogs. From a goose who lays their eggs on the top of a cliff to a koala that feeds its baby poop, it‚Äôs uncertain if they bad parents or just misunderstood. But no matter how bad one thinks they may be at parenting; they can‚Äôt be as bad as these guys.
